entry.title: Stats on compact block reconstructions
entry.summary: The inquiry delves into the underlying reasons for a specific observed phenomenon, raising questions about the mechanisms that might be influencing it. It speculates on whether inconsistencies in eviction policies across nodes or perhaps the presence of transactions that are relayed or prioritized outside the usual channels could be contributing factors. The focus is on understanding how these elements might affect the system's behavior and seeks to uncover the dynamics behind the observed issue. This exploration aims to identify the root causes by considering the impact of variable node eviction policies and the role of transactions that may not follow the standard path within the network infrastructure.
